title: Purple Inkstone of the Ming Dynasty (Minchô shiken) in 3 volumes; after Living Garden of Ming-dynasty Painting�� (Minchô Seidô Gaen) originally published by Ooka Shumboku (1680-1763) in 1746
creditline: Harvard Art Museums/Arthur M. Sackler Museum, Museum Collection
medium:
For detailed explanation of the relationship between "Minchô Shiken" and "Minchô Seidô Gaen" see Jack Hillier "The Art of the Japanese Book" vol. 1, pp. 205-209.
Accession Card says:  "Japan  Printed Book  Meiji (Tokugawa)
Mincho Shiken
3 volumes.  Album of living things, flowers, and insects.  Reprint, late.  Original 18th c.  Kyoto.  Publisher: Hishida Magobei.
No indication as to donor.  Found during the inventory of 1978.
(other 1978.477.numbers seem to designate Duel and Stillman books)
Has strange dedication written in pencil (in English) inside cover.
Exhibited: "Rocks, Mountains, Landscapes, and Gardens: The Essence of East Asian Painting" from February 15 - September 14 1997.
